qas.question: What is the term for a situation in which the president and prime minister come from different political parties?
What can the French parliament cause in order to oust the prime minister?
What french official must be approved by the parliment?
what can the prime minister force in order to oust the government in France?
What is it called when the president and and legislature are controlled by the same party

context: Appointment of the <b2_0>prime minister<b2_0/> of France requires no approval by the parliament either, but the parliament may force the <a1_0><b3_0>resignation of the government<b3_0/><a1_0/>. In these systems, it is possible for the president and the prime minister to be from different political parties if the legislature is controlled by a party different from that of the president. When it arises, such a state of affairs is usually referred to as (political) <a0_0><b4_0>cohabitation<b4_0/><a0_0/>.
